fields.description:
h3. Summary
Tomcat supports a setting of -1 to create an unlimited session timeout. When setting an unlimited session-timeout for Tomcat in {{<confluence-install>/conf/web.xml}} or {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/web.xml}}, instead of setting an unlimited session it prevents sessions from working as expected.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.8 or above (from tar.gz with system Java 8 JDK installed)
# Edit {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/web.xml}}:
## {{<session-timeout>-1<session-timeout>}}
# Start Confluence
# Create a new page
# Save

h3. Expected Results
The page saves as expected

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is shown in the browser:
{noformat}
Your session has expired. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.{noformat}
!session_error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Set a session timeout higher than 0 (for example, if your intent is to not have sessions timeout during the workday set it to 540)
fields.summary: Configuring Confluence with <session-timeout>-1</session-timeout> causes sessions to timeout immediately

fields.description:
Article [Creating a New Confluence Macro|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/tutorials/macro-tutorials-for-confluence/creating-a-new-confluence-macro] is outdated, leading to difficulty in completing the tutorial. 

For example, under Step 2 it says:

"Locate the com.example.plugins.tutorial.confluence package.This is located under src/main/java."

Under that directory, there are two packages: a .api and a .impl. There is no indication about which should be used.

For example, the test macro created after following the document appears under system *add-ons* and not under *user*. Crucially, it does not appear in the Macro browser, so there is no way of adding it to the page and test it.
fields.summary: Create a New Confluence Macro is outdated

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40227].
  {panel}

*Current Behavior*
Currently, it is not possible to add additional/extra colum in Jira Issue filter table limits in Confluence for note purposes such as adding relevant information to the issues or annotate project status.

*Requested Behavior*
Able to add additional columns to the table and add other Confluence content to each row (e.g. a status lozenge, a notes field). The content added to each row should remain synced with the JIRA issue for that row, so if the issues that match the issue filter changes, the custom content stays associated with the specific JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence user to add extra column in JIRA table in Confluence

fields.description:
Configuring the Daily Summary e-mail updates works and triggers all updates, however this does not include comments content.

When a single comment is added to a page, you'll receive an e-mail from the daily summary, but it will not include the content from that comment.

The [Daily Summary documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf54/confluence-user-s-guide/managing-changes-and-notifications-and-tasks/subscribing-to-email-notifications-of-updates-to-confluence-content] says that it should include comments content:
!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/184949/Daily%20Updates%20Inclusions.png!

This is similar to what was reported on [CONF-37335|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-37335], but is occurring with pages as well.
fields.summary: Daily Update Email does not include comments content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40217].
  {panel}

Please add an option to list only new content in the Recently Updated macro results (or more generally, an option to specify a list of update types: created, changed, etc.).

I need to review newly-added pages to ensure that they are being given good homes, to help keep the organization of our online content from degrading over time.

(I understand that changing the content of a page could change where in the tree it belongs; but the vast majority of changes don't have that effect.  New pages being added in inappropriate locations is a much more frequent problem.  Therefore, the "changed" notices in Recently Updated are mostly noise (for this purpose, anyway).)

Thanks much.
fields.summary: Add new-content-only option to Recently Updated macro.

fields.description:
I'm seeing the behaviour described in CONF-29989, but in one particular space.

I have confirmed with some random testing that 6 different pages in one particular space (including a new page) do not show the auto-complete for labels, while 1 page in each of 6 other spaces do show the auto-complete labels (including labels only found in the one 'broken' space).

Unfortunately, I do not know yet how to 'break' a space. I tried the test on CONF-14279 and it did not break the new space w.r.t. the label autocomplete dialog

I would have raised this at https://support.atlassian.com/customer/servicedesk-portal, but the site is down.

What can I do to help further diagnose the reproducibility of this issue?
fields.summary: Label autocomplete not populating in label edit dialog for pages in one particular space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40215].
{panel}
As a site admin, I don't want my first time users to have to watch spaces when they are doing on boarding on Confluence. Let them make this decision later. Please add a skip option in there too.
h3. Workaround

The default onboarding experience can be turned off by system administrators by going to Settings > Manage apps

And then changing the filter to "System" and searching for "Confluence Onboarding" there should be 1 matching add-on. Click on it and then click on the "Disable" button.

This will disable the onboarding experience and users will instead be taken straight to the dashboard on their first login without being required to watch or create a space.

See [How to skip the onboarding page (welcome.action) for new users in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-skip-the-onboarding-page-welcome-action-for-new-users-in-confluence-777016501.html].
h3. Solution

In Confluence 6.14.0 (to be released late January 2019), we replaced the existing onboarding flow for normal users (i.e. non-admins) with a simple modal dialog when they first login to Confluence. Users are no longer asked to watch a space.

Upgrading to Confluence 6.14.0 or newer will resolve this issue.
fields.summary: At Confluence Onboarding, add "skip" option for "watch spaces"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Office Document Images cannot be rendered (shows broken image) after a context path change in Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Confluence with a /confluence context
# Attach a word document with a few images in it
# Add a viewfile macro to the page where the document is attached
# Shutdown Confluence, then remove the /confluence context
# Startup Confluence, and navigate to the page is #3

h3. Expected Results
Images in the word document should be rendered correctly, and the request should be fired to http://localhost:8588/plugins/servlet/benryanconversion?pageId=7110658&attachment=test.doc&name=7340034&val=/image-1.jpeg (no context path)

h3. Actual Results
Images in the word document are broken, and the request is fired instead, to 
http://localhost:8588/confluence/plugins/servlet/benryanconversion?pageId=7110658&attachment=test.doc&name=7340034&val=/image-1.jpeg (the context path is still there)

h3.Workaround
# *Take a backup of* {{ConfluenceHome/viewfile}}
# Remove everything in {{ConfluenceHome/viewfile}}
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Broken Office Document Images After Change of Context Path

h4. Workaround
This has been observed to affect instances that have upgraded to 6.x and above with the Confluence Crucible Plugin installed. To resolve this issue, remove the offending plugin via the database following this approach:
# Create a safety backup of the {{plugindata}} table using your database tools
# Run the following query to remove the Confluence Crucible Plugin:
{code}
DELETE FROM plugindata WHERE pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.crucible.confluence-crucible-plugin';
{code}
# Start Confluence

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# User 1: Create a page with restrictions.
# User 2: As another user, navigate to page and request to be granted access
# User 1: Click 'button' in email to grant access. When directed to page, grant access.
# User 1: After some time, forget you clicked the link. Click it again in the email. Instead of getting a notice saying user already has access, they can at this point decide not to grant access, thinking User 2 therefore doesn't have access, but they actually do!

You get something like the picture each time (the encoding bug is ticketed already at CONF-40186)

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Sample url: https://confluence.oursite.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4066514&username=schulc4&userFullName=Smith%252C%2BJohn&grantAccess=true
fields.summary: Grant link can be used indefinitely

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# User 1: Create a page with restrictions.
# User 2: As another user, navigate to page and request to be granted access
# User 1: Click 'button' in email to grant access. When directed to page, witness bug.

My guess is that when the URL is being generated and isn't being decoded correctly. Interestingly, the URL has a username, so it could just do the lookup for the user's name behind the scenes and perhaps avoid the issue by taking that route.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Sample url: https://confluence.oursite.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4066514&username=schulc4&userFullName=Smith%252C%2BJohn&grantAccess=true
fields.summary: Encoding/decoding wrong in grant process

fields.description:
We host our own Confluence. A person has a user and is logged in, but can't be searched for by another user. When adding restrictions to a confluence page, it says no matches, but if you type in the user's id, then click "Restrict", it will actually work. So the results list doesn't agree with what is actually the case when it comes to users.

I guess it makes sense to hide some users (if they are inactive), but allowing the submission to bypass what the lists says exists/doesn't exist is a security flaw.

*Fix (Which feels like a work-around)*
We found that our users are not searchable until they have updated their profile picture.

While trying to find a work-around, we discovered CONF-40186.
fields.summary: User not searchable, but exists

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

It would be better to make Confluence Mobile configurable, by providing the following configuration options in the add-on:
# Display Confluence Mobile interface on mobile devices by default.
# Display Confluence Desktop interface on mobile devices, with a banner for switching to Mobile 
# Display Confluence Desktop interface on mobile devices, without a banner (to save screen real estate)
fields.summary: Configurable Confluence Mobile display

fields.description:
I am trying to add a new link to middle of a dense list of links, but it doesn't succeed.

\- I have a list of links, which I made dense with shift + enter at the end of each link in CONF-39514.
\- I go to the end of a link (_popup appears, I hit esc_)
\- Shift + enter to create row without gap (_popup appears, I hit esc_)
\- I click Insert link (_edit link dialog appears_)
\- I select Recently viewed (_list of recently viewed pages appear_)
\- I select a page (_it selects the page and suggests link text as text of the previous link_)
\- I can't change the text of the new link. What do I do?
\- I select Advanced (_advanced tab shows up in the dialog_)
\- There is no guide what to input. What do I do?
\- I check the syntax from somewhere
\- I write [Link text|Page name] and click Save (the list might get a link with wrong name or the list might just get messed up with spaces or merged links)

This doesn't happen always, but always there ends up being somekind of a mess.

For example if I add empty rows, then insert a link from the recently viewed tab, the dialog allows me to input a new text for the link. But then when I get rid of the line gaps like I did in issue CONF-39514, the links break. The new link merges with the link above it. And the link below it goes to the same line as the new link, but only after save. In preview only the link merging happens. The merged link is divided into two rows though. The merged link is only one link, but has two lines of text.
fields.summary: Editing dense list of links doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40181].
  {panel}

Perhaps I am not looking in the right place, or perhaps this doesn't exist natively in Confluence? It does in JIRA however. Here is basically want I am trying to accomplish, 

Take a CSV file, and create blank pages in Confluence based on it. Example would be:

PagePath, Title of Page, Page Body
Company>Company Rules, Chewing Gum, We do not allow gum on the premises
Company>Company Rules, Casual Friday, Wear what you like on Fridays! 

Something to this effect, just plan text for the body of the page. Is this possible in Confluence? I know you can do something like this for JIRA and have it create new issues and set reporters and the like.
fields.summary: Creating Pages from CSV

fields.description:
h6. Summary
Time value altered when _Office Excel_ or _Viewfile Macro_ is used for the value {{12:00:00 AM}} (Cell is formatted to _Time_ in _HH:MM AM/PM_ format).

h6. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new _.xls_ file in your local machine and add a cell with the value {{12:00:00 AM}}.
(i) Format this cell with _Time_ - _HH:MM AM/PM_ format.
# Add this newly created Excel file to your Confluence page.
# Insert an _Office Excel_ macro referring to this Excel file.

h6. Expected Results
By right the value should've been shown as {{00:00}}. Please refer to the attached screenshot (_ExpectedBehaviour.png_).

h6. Actual Results
Altered value shown in the Confluence UI and non-existent cell (value) is added. Please refer to the attached screenshot (_ObservedBehaviour.png_).
fields.summary: Altered Time Values in Office Excel/Viewfile Macro
Change bundled configuration to Http11Nio2Protocol

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40177].
  {panel}

When a page with a data: image is rendered by the word document exporter the data: is analyzed in N^2 time.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a new page
- Add a "roadmap" macro, default configuration
- Save the page
- Export the page as a doc file

Expected behaviour:
- The page is exported quickly

Actual behaviour:
- The page takes upwards of 45 seconds to render, in a purely CPU bound operation.  If a user attempts to reload the page, then now you've got two problems.

Note that this isn't an issue with the roadmap macro, that's just an easy way to create a data: image.
fields.summary: Exporting a page which contains a data: image to a word document runs in N^2 time
Confluence ignores the system property officeconnector.textextract.word.docxmaxsize

fields.description:
A customer disabled the *Mobile* add-on in Confluence, but after restarting the service, the add-on was automatically re-enabled.

I tested on the Confluence 5.8.17 and this issue doesn't happen. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
{panel}
*Confluence 5.9.1*
# Go to the *Manage Add-ons* page.
# Search for the *Mobile* add-on.
# Disable it.
# Restart the service.

*Results:*
The plugin is re-enabled.
{panel}

{panel}
*Confluence 5.8.17*
# Go to the *Manage Add-ons* page.
# Search for the *Mobile* add-on.
# Disable it.
# Restart the service.

*Results:*
The plugin is still disabled.
{panel}
fields.summary: Disabled bundled plugins are re-enabled after a Confluence restart

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

* When inserting a table within a Confluence page, the <thead> element, which is supposed to be used to group table heading elements, does not exist neither in Edit mode view, nor when exporting the page to HTML.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Insert a table within a Confluence page.
# Use *Heading row* function found in Editor toolbar to make heading cells.
# Save the page.
# Export page to HTML. Or:
# Enable the Inspector tool from your browser.
# Look for the <thead> element when page is in Edit mode view.

h3. Expected Results

* <thead> element should be associated with the table on HTML code.

h3. Actual Results

* <thead> table element is only found when page is not in Edit mode view (screen shot attached).
* <thead> element does not exist in exported HTML (index2.html) or when in Edit mode view (screen shot attached). This causes trouble when a table is split over more than one pages, hence the table header does not appear on the subsequent pages when exporting to HTML.

h3. Workaround
 
* For HTML Export situation, you ca manually insert <thead> element directly in the HTML code.
fields.summary: Missing <thead> table element when exporting page to HTML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40167].
{panel}
According to this documentation, Space admins are able to revoke permissions (this behaviour works as expected)

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/permissions-and-restrictions-724765432.html]
{quote}Page restrictions

Page restrictions work a little differently to global and space permissions. Pages are open to viewing or editing by default, but you can restrict either viewing or editing to certain users or groups if you need to.

Don't forget, every page in Confluence lives within a space, and space permissions allow the space admin to revoke permission to view content for the whole space. Even the ability to apply restrictions to pages is controlled by the 'restrict pages' space permission.
{quote}
 

However, as expected from the documentation, space admins are not able to modify restrictions on a page (only remove).

The suggestion is for the space admin to be able to *add* themself to view restrictions of a page to gain access. Not being able to do this means the space admin has to make the page accessible by anyone in the space (by removing the restrictions), before they're able to view the page.
fields.summary: Allow space admins to edit permissions for restricted pages
Product Demostration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40165].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If a fatal exception (ie, OutOfMemoryError) occurs during the processing of an attachment (such as a large/corrupt PDF or DOCX), Confluence will not record the failure.  When it restarts, it will re-try the indexing.  This leads to a loop of failure, and the application becomes unusable.

h3. Expected Result

Application fails catastrophically only once.  The underlying failure can be investigated and fixed, but the application does not enter a loop of catastrophic failures as it tries to index an invalid file.

h3. Actual Result

Applications enteres a loop of failures where it will become unavailable until Support (or other system administrator) removes the offending file.

h3. Workaround

Identify the file being indexed, and remove it.
fields.summary: Indexing attachments does not remember that an operation has been attempted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Most blueprints have reserved page title. A page with the reserved page title is additionally created when the related blueprint page is created for the first time. For example, a page with the title "How-to articles" is additionally created when you create a How-to article page for the first time.

Therefore, you cannot create a How-to article with title "How-to articles". You will see an error dialog saying "The page title 'How-to articles' is reserved. Please choose a different title", when you try to do it. I think it is a correct behavior.

However, the page stalls after you click "Create" button, if you input "Shared links" (the reserved title) for a page using "Share a link" template. Similarly, the page stalls if you input "File lists" (the reserved title) for a page using "File list" template. See also the attached. I think it is a bug.

Indeed people using English unlikely to face this bug because they unlikely to use the title "File lists" for a single file list page, however, people using the language where singular and plural nouns are spelled same (i.e. Japanese) may face the bug sometimes because they want to use the reserved page title sometimes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click "..." button right next to "Create" button on the header
# Click "Share a link" or "File list" template
# Input "Shared links" or "File lists" respectively for the title
# Click "Create"
# You will see it stalls. See also the attached

h3. Expected Results
You will see a create page view after you click the "Create" button

h3. Actual Results
You cannot see a create page view after you click the "Create" button. It stalls instead. See also the attached. No error is logged in the log files.
 
h3.Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: 'Create' button stalls when using the reserved page title for "File list" and "Share a link" blueprints

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40156].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are number of reasons mail queue could stuck with no notifications going out. Admins will not be informed to this unless they opened the [mail queue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-mail-queue-151387.html] page in the browser.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to monitor mail queue status over REST API calls

h3. Workaround
Monitor via JMX as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/live-monitoring-using-the-jmx-interface-150274182.html
fields.summary: REST API Call to query mail queue status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40154].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
A page with the "Content by label" macro, combined with an Excerpt Display of "Rich content", will render itself leading to a stack overflow.

*This causes:*
* high CPU usage with more than 10MB of log every second.
* Confluence becomes unresponsive until the overflow finishes.
* Going to the page can also return an Error page when the page is displayed.
* The page may render with infinite traces of itself.
* In Cloud the page will automatically try to refresh every 2 minutes if window is left open and will trigger the problem again.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0 or 5.9
* Content by Label macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a "Content by label" macro, configured as:
#* Label: "testing"
#* Excerpt Display: "rich content"
# Save the page
# Add a label to the page: "testing"
# Refresh the page (May require 2 or 3 refreshes for the label to be updated)

h3. Expected Results
Page renders quickly and no error are shown in the logs.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40151].
  {panel}

I think if every selectable character in a cell is selected and deleted, that a natural expectation would be that the cell is then completely empty.

If a UL/LI element is the first item in the table, the UL/LI remains even after deletion of everything selectable.

Reproduce:
1. Have a table
2. Put bulleted list in cell and type stuff
3. Select everything you just typed
4. Hit "backspace" on your keyboard
5. Look at the bullet

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Code Block macro with the documentation theme, the style of the macro differs from the Default theme. A white padding is inserted around the text, instead of keeping the colour as per the selected theme.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page and add the Code Block macro.
# Select any of the dark themes for the macro, e.g: RDark and Save the page.
# Switch the theme of your page to the Default theme.

h3. Expected Results
The code block would show up nicely as it does in the Global Look and Feel theme; all the content of the container in the same color.

h3. Actual Results
Within the code box, there's a white padding between the letters and the border of the container (see screenshots).
 
h3.Workaround
Use the Global Look and Feel theme:
# Click *Browse > Space Admin*.
# Click *Themes* in the left menu.
# Select the Global Look and Feel theme and click *Confirm*.
fields.summary: Using Code Block macro with the Documentation theme alters the style of the macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40146].
  {panel}

The new page data and tools bar will render on top of a link target when the link of a target is above the link. Due to this the link target is hidden what confuses the user.

Steps to reproduce:
* generate a page with some headings and text
* at the bottom of the page insert a link to one of the headings above
* the bar will render on top of the linked heading hiding it
fields.summary: Page data and tools bar might hide link targets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40144].
  {panel}

It's not very easy to tell what a user has changed on a page containing the Roadmap macro -- it would be great to be able to see recent changes, or compare page versions.

*Page Comparison*
Currently doing a page comparison, all we see is a bunch of url-encoded data, which is not very legible. 
* Simply adding linefeeds between the various rows within the following xml would help, so we can at least see what entity has changed {code}<ac:parameter ac:name="source"> ... {code}

*Changelog*
* Could you add a "Changelog" section to the Roadmap macro, which is normally collapsed/invisible -- but displays logs like the following:
** <Date>: <Bar 1> modified by <Username>
** <Date>: <Bar 4> added <Username>
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner Macro: Improve ability to view changes / Page History display
ability to copy labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40137].
  {panel}

We just upgraded to Confluence 5.9.1 to get rid of an indexing bug. Now we have another problem and I'm not sure it's related to the upgrade because it's not consistent, so here goes.

We use Confluence for our manuals and are trying to single source, so we want to keep all the images for a manual/product in one place to make they easy to upgrade and use multiple places. It's always been easy just to paste them into a page that we call an image gallery. When we use them, the remain attached to that page but appear   in the manual wherever placed. But the manual itself doesn't have attachments.

After upgrade one of our team noticed that when the copies and pastes, the manual page now has an attachment. Bad.  We can still insert with no attachment but copy/paste is so much easier and faster, and our people like fast and easy.

I did a test in a test paste and the image copy/paste worked just like it used to: No attachment. But back in the space he was working in, my test showed that the attachments were showing up on the manual page.  

So what is going on? Do you have any idea? Why is this feature acting differently in two different spaces and which way is it supposed to work now.  And can we get back our fast and easy method. Our team and other contributors like it as it was.

Thank you for any help with this problem. Confluence is very important to our business. We need to understand what is happening.
fields.summary: Image attachment problem after upgrade
Atlassian Answers: Allow commenting on own question regardless of points

I have a very specific use case.

I have around 350~400 jira queries on one confluence page generated by a page property report of ten other pages. These pages are 10 projects with each 8 fixVersions displayed and each fixVersion contains four different queries. See the pictures attached for my usecase.

Is there any possibility to improve the performance of the JIRA issues macro? The page with the page properties macro takes around 30 seconds to load the complete site which is not applicable for us to wait so long.

Best regards and thank you in advance for taking care of this issue.
Christoph

h3. Summary
Session timeout never occurred on Confluence Data Center.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence Data Center on two nodes with following [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-confluence-data-center-203603.html]
# Change {{<confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/web.xml}} on each node as follows (Set session-timeout to 1 min)
{code}
<session-config>
  <session-timeout>1</session-timeout>
</session-config>
{code}
# Start Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Session timeout should occur in 1 min on web browser.

h3. Actual Results
Session timeout never occured.
 
h3. Notes
This problem occurred only on Data Center version.
Is it related to CONF-26796?

This is a task request to change and add some specific content on the following Dev's documentation:

https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-plugin-guide/confluence-plugin-module-types/dialog-wizard-module

This doc is specifying that *'key'* is a required element. Instead, it seems to be using *'id'* in the example.is used instead, yet that is not included in the documentation.

Documentation for dialog-page does not include information on the attribute "last" despite that element being included in the Step 6 on https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-plugin-guide/confluence-blueprints/write-an-intermediate-blueprint-plugin as well as several other locations.

h3. Summary

When rebuilding indexes as mentioned in the documentation [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+rebuild+the+content+indexes+from+scratch]
causes confluence to error on startup
h5. Steps to reproduce
 # Start Confluence, set it up and shut it down
 # Delete the index directory (as if you were rebuilding the index from scratch)
 # Start Confluence again

h5. Expected Results
 # Confluence creates the index directory, and the edge directory

h5. Actual Results
 * Confluence creates the index directory, but not the edge directory.
 * Errors such as *Aww shoot, we can't find that page.* appear when clicking on the Popular tab.
 * The "Confluence Edge Index" plugin is disabled
 * If the site is accessed via a mobile device or via the URL ([http://confluence.company.com/plugins/servlet/mobile#dashboard]), the error
{panel}There was an error loading the stream items.
{panel}
appears.

 * The following log entry can be found in {{atlassian-confluence.log}}

 creating bean with name 'directory': FactoryBean threw exception on object creation; nested exception is com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: java.io.IOException: Unable to create index directory '/Users/dayanaazmi/CONF_591PostgreSQL_Home/index/edge'

	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.FactoryBeanRegistrySupport.doGetObjectFromFactoryBean(FactoryBeanRegistrySupport.java:175)

Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: java.io.IOException: Unable to create index directory '/Users/dayanaazmi/CONF_591PostgreSQL_Home/index/edge'

	... 28 more

h5. Notes

This is *not* related to Filesystem permissions. The parent folder is created, and files are placed in it, which suggests that the folder and it's contents are writeable

This has been observed in Windows and Linux.
h5. Workaround

Create the {{confluence-home/index/edge}} folder, and then manually enable the "Confluence Edge Index" plugin.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an attachment in Confluence pages has a newer version, the download link for the older version of that attachment is pointing to the newest version

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1
* Confluence 6.0 OD
* Last seen working normally (This bug does not exist ) in Confluence 5.7.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Confluence page, edit and add an attachment, save the page
# Click on the attachment. The view file would show up 
# On the upper right of the page, click "Uplaod new version" and upload a different attachment than the previous one. Click Done and Exit
# Back on the Confluence page, click on the new attachment and again, the view file whould show up
# On the upper left side, choose the "Version 1" of the attachment
# Click the Download button on the top right

h3. Expected Results
The downloaded file is the Version 1 attachment 

h3. Actual Results
The downloaded file is the latest version of the attachment

The link of the download is:
{code}
<BASE_URL>/download/attachments/<attachment_ID>/<attachment name>?version=<current version>&modificationDate=<xxxxxX>&api=v2&download=true
{code}

Note that the string {{version}} would always be "current version", and not the version desired 
 
h3.Workaround
Go to Page Tools (on the top right side of a confluence page) and choose attachments. Expand the attachment that you would like to download and you will be able to choose and download the older version of the attachment
fields.summary: Older versions of an Attachment cannot be downloaded

Use case:

User cannot find a relevant article in our Confluence

Click this custom button ("Can't find what you're looking for?") and it will load a form so someone can provide a short description of what they're looking for.

Once saved, this will then mail a group of Confluence admins for action (either to create an article or point in the right direction)

  {panel}

h3. Summary
There is a CPU spike that hangs when using the Attachments macro. This can be consistently replicated when there are 200+ attachments in a Confluence page. The issues seems to be the number of attachments since testing with 1 large file (e.g. 1 GB) rather than 200 medium-sized files does not cause the same issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 200+ test attachments. The following Linux script can be used to create 200 txt files from an exisitng Confluence log file {code} for f in {0..200}
do
    cat atlassian-confluence.log > "$f.txt"
done	{code}
# Log in to Confluence
# Create a test space and test page
# Drag and drop the 200 test files to the page
# Keep an eye on the CPU usage. The CPU should be stable at this point
# Edit the Confluence page and add the Attachments macro
# Save the page
# Notice the CPU will spike and hang
# Disable the 'Confluence Attachments Plugin' and notce the CPU goes down almost instantly

h3. Expected Results
The CPU does not hang for long periods of time.

The CPU will spike and hang.
